project.name: Task Manager
project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

bottlenecks: Frequent queries on the 'tasks' table may cause a bottleneck, especially when retrieving tasks for a specific user or category.
The 'task_tags' table may become a bottleneck if a large number of tasks have multiple tags, leading to slow query performance.
Authentication endpoints may experience high traffic, causing a bottleneck if not properly optimized.
securityIssues: Data transmission between the client and server may be vulnerable to interception if SSL/TLS encryption is not implemented.
Authentication endpoints may be susceptible to brute-force attacks if proper rate limiting and password hashing are not in place.
Sensitive data, such as user settings and task details, may be exposed if proper access controls and authorization are not enforced.
cachingOpportunities: Caching frequently accessed categories and priorities can reduce the load on the database and improve response times.
Implementing caching for user settings and task lists can minimize the number of database queries and improve overall system performance.
Caching authentication tokens or user sessions can reduce the load on the authentication endpoints and improve user experience.
transformationPoints: Data transformation occurs when tasks are retrieved from the database and converted into a format suitable for the client, such as JSON.
When creating or updating tasks, data transformation takes place to validate and sanitize user input before storing it in the database.
When retrieving user settings, data transformation may occur to convert the settings into a format suitable for the client or to apply default values.

relationships.description: A user can have multiple tasks assigned to them.
A category can have multiple tasks associated with it.
A task can have multiple tags associated with it.
A user can have multiple permissions assigned to them.

indexRecommendations.reason: The logs table is likely to be queried by timestamp, and an index on this field would improve query performance.
The tasks table is likely to be queried by category and user, and a composite index on these fields would improve query performance.
The task_tags table is likely to be queried by task and tag, and a composite index on these fields would improve query performance.

normalizationIssues.issue: The tasks table has 11 fields, which may indicate that it is not fully normalized.
normalizationIssues.suggestion: Consider breaking out the tasks table into separate tables for task metadata and task details to improve normalization.

normalizationIssues.issue: The settings table has 6 fields, which may indicate that it is not fully normalized.
normalizationIssues.suggestion: Consider breaking out the settings table into separate tables for user settings and system settings to improve normalization.

performanceWarnings: The logs table has no indexes, which may lead to slow query performance.
The tasks table has 11 fields, which may lead to slow query performance and data redundancy.
The task_tags table may lead to slow query performance if not properly indexed.

data.name: Tasks

endpoints.description: Get task by id - GET /api/v1/tasks/{id} (Auth Required)

data.name: Categories

endpoints.description: Get category by id - GET /api/v1/categories/{id} (Auth Required)
Get priority by id - GET /api/v1/priorities/{id} (Auth Required)

data.name: Settings

endpoints.description: Get setting by key - GET /api/v1/settings/{key} (Auth Required)

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing task data, user information, and other application metadata with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: MySQL
recommendations.description: Popular open-source relational database known for reliability, ease of use, and wide adoption in web applications with strong read performance

pricing.details: Free and open-source, hosting costs vary

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for transactions, excellent support for complex queries needed for task management, and JSON support for flexible metadata. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features.

decisions.title: Cloud Infrastructure Selection
decisions.description: Select the cloud platform that will host the entire application infrastructure, providing compute, storage, networking, and managed services

recommendations.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
recommendations.description: Leading cloud platform with the most comprehensive service portfolio including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and 200+ services for building scalable applications
pros: Largest service portfolio in the industry
cons: Complex pricing can be difficult to predict

pricing.details: Pay-as-you-go for most services, reserved instances available for cost savings

recommendations.name: Google Cloud Platform
recommendations.description: Google's cloud platform with strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and excellent Kubernetes support through GKE

pricing.details: Generally 20-30% cheaper than AWS for compute and storage with sustained use discounts

decisions.reasoning: AWS is recommended as the cloud provider due to its comprehensive service portfolio that can support all components of the task management platform, mature ecosystem with proven reliability at scale, and strong marketplace for third-party integrations.

decisions.title: CI/CD Pipeline Selection
decisions.description: Choose the continuous integration and deployment platform for automating build, test, and deployment workflows

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its seamless integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML-based workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation.

decisions.title: Caching Layer Selection
decisions.description: Choose the caching solution to improve application performance by reducing database queries and enhancing user experience

recommendations.name: Redis
recommendations.description: In-memory data store that can be used as a caching layer, message broker, and database with excellent performance and support for various data structures
cons: Potential data loss in case of failure
Requires careful configuration for high availability

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

decisions.reasoning: Redis is recommended for its high performance, in-memory data store capabilities, and excellent support for various data structures, making it suitable for real-time web applications like task management.

decisions.title: API Gateway Selection
decisions.description: Choose the API gateway solution to manage API requests, handle authentication, and provide a single entry point for clients

recommendations.name: Kong
recommendations.description: Popular open-source API gateway with excellent performance, scalability, and support for various plugins and extensions
cons: Requires careful management of plugins and dependencies

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

decisions.reasoning: Kong is recommended for its high performance, scalable architecture, and excellent support for various plugins and extensions, making it suitable for microservices architecture and real-time web applications like task management.

decisions.title: Authentication Solution Selection
decisions.description: Choose the authentication solution to manage user identities, handle login and registration, and provide secure access to the application

recommendations.name: Auth0
recommendations.description: Popular commercial authentication platform with excellent support for various authentication protocols, social login, and multi-factor authentication
pros: Excellent support for various authentication protocols

pricing.details: Pricing varies based on features and user count

decisions.reasoning: Auth0 is recommended for its excellent support for various authentication protocols, social login, and multi-factor authentication, making it suitable for securing real-time web applications like task management.

decisions.title: Monitoring Solution Selection
decisions.description: Choose the monitoring solution to track application performance, detect issues, and provide insights for optimization

recommendations.name: Prometheus
recommendations.description: Popular open-source monitoring system with excellent support for metrics collection, alerting, and visualization
cons: Requires careful management of metrics and alerting rules
Limited support for certain data sources

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

decisions.reasoning: Prometheus is recommended for its excellent support for metrics collection, alerting, and visualization, making it suitable for real-time monitoring of web applications like task management.

decisions.title: Logging Solution Selection
decisions.description: Choose the logging solution to track application logs, detect issues, and provide insights for optimization

recommendations.name: ELK Stack
recommendations.description: Popular open-source logging solution with excellent support for log collection, processing, and visualization
cons: Requires careful management of log sources and indices
Limited support for certain log formats

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

decisions.reasoning: ELK Stack is recommended for its excellent support for log collection, processing, and visualization, making it suitable for real-time logging of web applications like task management.

decisions.title: Search Engine Selection
decisions.description: Choose the search engine solution to provide fast and relevant search results for tasks and other application data

recommendations.name: Elasticsearch
recommendations.description: Popular open-source search engine with excellent support for full-text search, filtering, and aggregation
cons: Requires careful management of indices and mappings
Limited support for certain data formats

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

decisions.reasoning: Elasticsearch is recommended for its excellent support for full-text search, filtering, and aggregation, making it suitable for providing fast and relevant search results for tasks and other application data.

decisions.title: Notification Service Selection
decisions.description: Choose the notification service to send notifications to users about task updates, assignments, and other relevant events

recommendations.name: OneSignal
recommendations.description: Popular commercial notification service with excellent support for push notifications, in-app messaging, and email notifications

pricing.details: Pricing varies based on features and user count

decisions.reasoning: OneSignal is recommended for its excellent support for push notifications, in-app messaging, and email notifications, making it suitable for sending notifications to users about task updates and other relevant events.

decisions.title: Analytics Solution Selection
decisions.description: Choose the analytics solution to track user behavior, monitor application performance, and provide insights for optimization

recommendations.name: Google Analytics
recommendations.description: Popular analytics solution with excellent support for tracking user behavior, monitoring application performance, and providing insights for optimization
pros: Excellent support for tracking user behavior

pricing.details: Free to use, paid plans for advanced features

decisions.reasoning: Google Analytics is recommended for its excellent support for tracking user behavior, monitoring application performance, and providing insights for optimization, making it suitable for tracking user behavior and optimizing the task management application.

decisions.title: CDN Selection
decisions.description: Choose the content delivery network to distribute static assets, reduce latency, and improve user experience

recommendations.name: Cloudflare
recommendations.description: Popular CDN with excellent support for distributing static assets, reducing latency, and improving user experience
pros: Excellent support for distributing static assets

pricing.details: Free to use, paid plans for advanced features

decisions.reasoning: Cloudflare is recommended for its excellent support for distributing static assets, reducing latency, and improving user experience, making it suitable for improving the performance and user experience of the task management application.

financial: Cost overruns due to unexpected infrastructure costs
Revenue impact due to application downtime

databaseRecommendations.name: PostgreSQL
reasons: support for advanced indexing for efficient search and filter
cons: may require additional configuration for optimal performance
not ideal for very large amounts of unstructured data
whyForUseCase: supports basic authentication and data privacy compliance
efficient handling of task creation and updates

databaseRecommendations.name: MySQL
reasons: easy to set up and manage
databaseRecommendations.bestFor: small to medium-sized applications with straightforward data models
pros: supports a wide range of storage engines
cons: may not perform as well under high load
not as robust as PostgreSQL in terms of data integrity
whyForUseCase: simple and efficient for handling task data

databaseRecommendations.name: Redis
reasons: in-memory data storage for high performance
supports pub/sub messaging for real-time sync
pros: very high performance and low latency
supports a wide range of data structures
cons: data is stored in RAM, so may not be suitable for large amounts of data
not as robust as relational databases in terms of data integrity
whyForUseCase: supports real-time sync and efficient handling of task updates
can be used as a caching layer to improve performance

databaseRecommendations.name: SQLite
databaseRecommendations.bestFor: small, self-contained applications with simple data models
pros: very lightweight and easy to embed
cons: not suitable for large or distributed applications
may not perform well under high load
whyForUseCase: simple and easy to use for small task management applications
supports basic data types and SQL queries

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Break down the application into smaller services for tasks, categories, and authentication to improve modularity and scalability. Use RESTful APIs for communication between services.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-Time Sync
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis for real-time data synchronization across users and services. Implement pub/sub messaging for instant updates and use Redis as a cache layer for frequently accessed data.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement JWT-Based Authentication
smartRecommendations.description: Use JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication and authorization. Generate tokens upon successful login and validate them on each request to ensure secure access to protected routes.

smartRecommendations.title: Optimize Database Queries with Indexing
smartRecommendations.description: Create indexes on frequently queried columns (e.g., task due dates, categories) to improve query performance. Use EXPLAIN statements to analyze and optimize slow queries.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Load Balancing for Scalability
smartRecommendations.description: Set up load balancing to distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances of the application. Use a cloud provider's load balancing service or a tool like HAProxy.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Data Encryption
smartRecommendations.description: Use SSL/TLS encryption for data in transit and at rest. Encrypt sensitive data (e.g., user passwords, task descriptions) using a secure encryption algorithm like AES.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create Indexes on Frequently Queried Columns
optimizationSuggestions.description: Create indexes on columns used in WHERE, JOIN, and ORDER BY clauses, such as task_id, user_id, category_id, due_date, and priority_level. This will significantly speed up query execution times.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Redis Caching for Frequently Accessed Data
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis to cache frequently accessed data, such as user information, category lists, and task metadata. This will reduce the load on the database and improve response times.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Optimize Database Queries for Real-Time Sync
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use efficient database queries to retrieve and update task data in real-time. Consider using WebSockets or Webhooks to push updates to connected clients.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Use Load Balancing to Distribute Traffic
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use a load balancer to distribute incoming traffic across multiple instances of the application. This will improve responsiveness and ensure that no single instance becomes a bottleneck.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Efficient Authentication and Authorization
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use a secure authentication mechanism, such as OAuth or JWT, to authenticate users. Implement role-based access control to ensure that users can only access and modify their own tasks and data.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Schedule Regular Database Backups and Cleanup
optimizationSuggestions.description: Schedule regular backups of the database to ensure data integrity and availability. Also, implement a cleanup mechanism to remove outdated or unnecessary data, such as completed tasks or inactive user accounts.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Performance Monitoring and Alerting
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use a monitoring tool, such as New Relic or Prometheus, to track application performance and alert on potential issues. This will help identify and resolve problems before they impact users.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Strong Password Policies
securityRecommendations.description: Enforce password length, complexity, and rotation policies to prevent brute-force attacks. Use a secure password hashing algorithm like bcrypt or Argon2 to store user passwords.

securityRecommendations.title: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
securityRecommendations.description: Add an extra layer of security by requiring users to provide a second form of verification, such as a code sent to their phone or a biometric scan, in addition to their password.

securityRecommendations.title: Use Encryption for Data at Rest and in Transit
securityRecommendations.description: Use a secure encryption algorithm like AES to protect user data stored in the database and in transit between the client and server. Use HTTPS (TLS) to encrypt data in transit.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
securityRecommendations.description: Define roles for users and assign permissions accordingly to ensure that users can only access and modify their own tasks and data. Use a secure authorization framework to enforce RBAC.

securityRecommendations.title: Regularly Update and Patch Dependencies
securityRecommendations.description: Keep all dependencies, including libraries and frameworks, up to date with the latest security patches to prevent known vulnerabilities from being exploited.

securityRecommendations.title: Monitor and Log Security-Related Events
securityRecommendations.description: Implement logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security-related events, such as login attempts, data access, and system changes. Use a secure logging framework to store and analyze logs.

indexingPriority.reason: Frequent search, filter, and real-time sync operations
Frequent read operations for task organization
Infrequent updates and mostly read-only operations

performanceMetrics.label: Expected QPS
performanceMetrics.description: Queries per second estimate for small team usage

performanceMetrics.label: Data Growth
performanceMetrics.description: Estimated data growth rate for 100+ active users
